intro: Raimondia conica, commonly known as the conical raimondia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive conical shape and clusters of small, white or pink flowers. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often grown as an ornamental plant. Its leaves are typically heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs.
